title: Chocolate hobnob-style biscuits (vegan)
time: Hands-on time 15 min, oven time 10-12 min
description: We’ve created our very own vegan chocolate hobnobs biscuit recipe, with a thick chocolate topping and a wholemeal, oaty base. Grab a cuppa and get dunking!
ingredients: 125g wholemeal flour, plus extra to dust
100g unrefined golden caster sugar (we used Billington’s)
50g unrefined dark muscovado sugar (we used Billington’s)

method.Step 1: Heat the oven to 160°C/140°C fan/ gas 3. Mix the rolled oats, flours and sugars with a pinch of salt in a mixing bowl.

method.Step 2: Put the oil and golden syrup in a large pan set over a medium heat and melt together. Remove from the heat.

method.Step 3: Mix the bicarbonate of soda and boiling water in a small dish, tip into the warm oil/syrup and stir to combine – it will froth up. Pour the mixture over the dry ingredients and mix to form a dough.

method.Step 4: Roll spoonfuls of the dough into walnut-size balls. Space them roughly 5cm apart on the prepared baking trays and flatten slightly with the heel of your hand.

method.Step 5: Bake for 10-12 minutes until deep golden brown. Remove from the oven and leave on the baking trays for 5-6 minutes to firm up a little. Loosen with a palette knife, transfer to a wire rack and leave to cool (see Make Ahead).

method.Step 6: Once cooled, spoon a little melted dark chocolate over each biscuit and spread with the back of a spoon, or use a knife or fork to create a ridged pattern (see tip).
